column1: Art Institute of Chicago////How are so many globally iconic works of art just sitting in a mid-tier city in the Midwest? I love Chicago
column3: but this collection of art is on par with what you would find in Vienna or Paris and that is suprising. I guess Chicago really is the Paris of the Midwest..... and that's only 10% said in jest. The impressionist collection alone is worth the price of admission
column4: round that out with pieces like Night Hawks
column5: sculptures by Dega. Windows by Marc Chagall
column8: the list goes on.  Nice armor collection
column9: overall think of this like a smaller Met Museum
column10: same vibe and about 1/3 the size
column11: breadth and depth of collection. A must see.
